Speaker: PENCE
Text: At a time when literally, in the wake of Hillary Clinton's tenure as secretary of state, where she was the architect of the Obama administration's foreign policy, we see entire portions of the world, particularly the wider Middle East, literally spinning out of control.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: I mean, the situation we're watching hour by hour in Syria today is the result of the failed foreign policy and the weak foreign policy that Hillary Clinton helped lead in this administration and create.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: The newly emboldened -- the aggression of Russia, whether it was in Ukraine or now they're heavy-handed approach...

Speaker: KAINE
Text: You guys love Russia.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: I mean, the reality is, when she was secretary of state, Senator, come on.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: She had a Clinton Foundation accepting contributions from foreign governments.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: She worked to deal with the Russians to reduce their chemical weapons stockpile.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: She worked a tough negotiation with nations around the world to eliminate the Iranian nuclear weapons program without firing a shot.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: Eliminate the Iranian nuclear weapons program?

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Absolutely, without firing a shot.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And instead of 175,000 American troops deployed overseas, we now have 15,000.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: ... and overrun vast areas of Iraq.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Governor, President Bush said we would leave Iraq at the end of 2011.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And, Elaine, Iraq didn't want our troops to stay, and they wouldn't give us the protection for our troops.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And guess what?

Speaker: KAINE
Text: If a nation where our troops are serving does not want us to stay, we're not going to stay without their protection.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: It was a failure of the secretary of state...

Speaker: PENCE
Text: The state of Indiana has balanced budgets.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: We cut taxes, we've made record investments in education and in infrastructure, and I still finish my term with $2 billion in the bank.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: In the state of Indiana, we've cut unemployment in half; unemployment doubled when he was governor.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: But I think he's a very fitting running mate for Hillary Clinton, because in the wake of a season where American families are struggling in this economy under the weight of higher taxes and Obamacare and the war on coal and the stifling avalanche of regulation coming out of this administration, Hillary Clinton and Tim Kaine want more of the same.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: But a trillion dollars in tax increases, more regulation, more of the same war on coal, and more of Obamacare that now even former President Bill Clinton calls Obamacare a crazy plan.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: But Hillary Clinton and Tim Kaine want to build on Obamacare.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: They want to expand it into a single-payer program.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: And for all the world, Hillary Clinton just thinks Obamacare is a good start.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: Look, Donald Trump and I have a plan to get this economy moving again just the way that it worked in the 1980s, just the way it worked in the 1960s, and that is by lowering taxes across the board for working families, small businesses and family farms, ending the war on coal that is hurting jobs and hurting this economy even here in Virginia, repealing Obamacare lock, stock, and barrel, and repealing all of the executive orders that Barack Obama has signed that are stifling economic growth in this economy.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: The Trump plan is a different plan.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: It's a "you're fired" plan.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And there's two key elements to it.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: First, Donald Trump said wages are too high.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And both Donald Trump and Mike Pence think we ought to eliminate the federal minimum wage.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Mike Pence, when he was in Congress, voted against raising the minimum wage above $5.15.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And he has been a one-man bulwark against minimum wage increases in Indiana.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: The second component of the plan is massive tax breaks for the very top, trillions of dollars of tax breaks for people just like Donald Trump.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: The problem with this, Elaine, is that's exactly what we did 10 years ago and it put the economy into the deepest recession -- the deepest recession since the 1930s.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Independent analysts say the Clinton plan would grow the economy by 10.5 million jobs.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: The Trump plan would cost 3.5 million jobs.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: I mean, the truth of the matter is, the policies of this administration, which Hillary Clinton and Senator Kaine want to continue, have run this economy into a ditch.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: We're in the...

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Fifteen million new jobs?

Speaker: PENCE
Text: ... slowest economic recovery since the Great Depression.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: There are millions more people living in poverty today than the day that Barack Obama with Hillary Clinton at his side...

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And the poverty level and the median income...

Speaker: PENCE
Text: ... stepped into the Oval Office.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: ... improved dramatically between 2014 and 2015.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: And he will.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: He's broken his first promise.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Governor Pence had to give Donald Trump his tax returns to show he was qualified to be vice president.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Donald Trump must give the American public his tax returns to show that he's qualified to be president.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And he's breaking his promise.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Richard Nixon released tax returns when he was under audit.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: They're going to raise your taxes.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: We're going to cut your taxes.

Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: Gentlemen...

Speaker: KAINE
Text: If you can't meet Nixon's standard...

Speaker: KAINE
Text: We will never, ever engage in a risky scheme to privatize Social Security.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Donald Trump wrote a book and he said Social Security is a Ponzi scheme and privatization would be good for all of us.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And when Congressman Pence was in Congress, he was the chief cheerleader for the privatization of Social Security.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Even after President Bush stopped pushing for it, Congressman Pence kept pushing for it.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: You're not going to cut taxes.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: You're going to raise taxes on the middle class.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: ... reform government programs so we can meet the obligations of Social Security and Medicare.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: I'm a gun-owner.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: I'm a strong Second Amendment supporter.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: But I've got a lot of scar tissue, because when I was governor of Virginia, there was a horrible shooting at Virginia Tech, and we learned that through that painful situation that gaps in the background record check system should have been closed and it could have prevented that crime, and so we're going to work to do things like close background record checks.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: It's probably -- probably why the 330,000 members of the Fraternal Order of Police endorsed Donald Trump as the next president of the United States of America, because they see his commitment to them.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: They see his commitment to law and order.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: But they also -- they also hear the bad mouthing, the bad mouthing that comes from people that seize upon tragedy in the wake of police action shootings as -- as a reason to -- to use a broad brush to accuse law enforcement of -- of implicit bias or institutional racism.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: But he had been stopped by police 40 or 50 times before that fatal incident.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And if you look at sentencing in this country, African-Americans and Latinos get sentenced for the same crimes at very different rates.

Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: Your fellow Republican, Governor Pence, Senator Tim Scott, who is African-American, recently spoke on the Senate floor.

Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: He said he was stopped seven times by law enforcement in one year.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Donald Trump during his campaign has called Mexicans rapists and criminals.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: He's called women slobs, pigs, dogs, disgusting.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: I don't like saying that in front of my wife and my mother.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: He attacked an Indiana-born federal judge and said he was unqualified to hear a federal lawsuit because his parents were Mexican.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: He went after John McCain, a POW, and said he wasn't hero because he'd been captured.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: He said African-Americans are living in Hell.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And he perpetrated this outrageous and bigoted lie that President Obama is not a U.S. citizen.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: If you want to have a society where people are respected and respect laws, you can't have somebody at the top who demeans every group that he talks about.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And I just -- again, I cannot believe that Governor Pence will defend the insult-driven campaign that Donald Trump has run.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: Donald Trump's laid out a plan to end illegal immigration once and for all in this country.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: We've been talking it to death for 20 years.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: Hillary Clinton and Tim Kaine want to continue the policies of open borders, amnesty, catch and release, sanctuary cities, all the things that are driving -- that are driving wages down in this country, Senator, and also too often with criminal aliens in the country, it's bringing heartbreak.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: I mean, to be honest with you, if Donald Trump had said all of the things that you've said he said in the way you said he said them, he still wouldn't have a fraction of the insults that Hillary Clinton leveled when she said that half of our supporters were a basket of deplorables.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: It's -- she said they were irredeemable, they were not American.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Did he apologize for saying African-Americans are living in Hell?

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Did he apologize for saying President Obama was not even a citizen of the United States?

Speaker: KAINE
Text: You will look in vain to see Donald Trump ever taking responsibility for anybody and apologizing.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: These guys -- and Donald Trump have said it -- deportation force.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: They want to go house to house, school to school, business to business, and kick out 16 million people.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Our plan is like Ronald Reagan's plan from 1986.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: They call it comprehensive immigration reform on Capitol Hill.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: The reality is that there's heartbreak and tragedy that has struck American families because people that came into this country illegally are now involved in criminal enterprise and activity.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: And we don't have the resources or the will to deport them systemically.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: When Donald Trump spoke in Phoenix, he looked the audience in the eye and he said, no, we're building a wall, and we're deporting everybody.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: He said, quote, "They will all be gone."

Speaker: KAINE
Text: They will all be gone.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And this is one of these ones where you can just go to the tape on it and see what Donald Trump has said.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Donald Trump doesn't have a plan.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: He said, "I have a secret plan," and then he said, "Um, I know more than all the generals about ISIL."

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And then he said, "I'm going to call the generals to help me figure out a plan."

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And finally he said, "I'm going to fire all the generals."

Speaker: KAINE
Text: He doesn't have a plan.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And last and most dangerously, Donald Trump believes -- Donald Trump believes that the world will be safer if more nations have nuclear weapons.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: He's said Saudi Arabia should get them, Japan should get them, Korea should get them.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And when he was confronted with this, and told, wait a minute, terrorists could get those, proliferation could lead to nuclear war, here's what Donald Trump said, and I quote: "Go ahead, folks, enjoy yourselves."

Speaker: KAINE
Text: ... put a program in place to keep them out if they're from Syria.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And yesterday an appellate court with three Republican judges struck down the Pence plan...

Speaker: KAINE
Text: That's why Donald Trump's claim that he wants to -- that NATO is obsolete and that we need to get rid of NATO is so dangerous.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: That's not his plan.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Well, he said NATO is obsolete.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And all investigation concluded that not one reasonable prosecutor would take any additional step.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: You don't get to decide the rights and wrongs of this.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: We have a justice system that does that.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And a Republican FBI director did an investigation and concluded that...

Speaker: PENCE
Text: Hillary Clinton's top priority when she became secretary of state was the Russian reset, the Russians reset.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: After the Russian reset, the Russians invaded Ukraine and took over Crimea.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Donald Trump, again and again, has praised Vladimir Putin.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And it's clear that he has business dealings with Russian oligarchs who are very connected to Putin.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: The Trump campaign management team had to be fired a month or so ago because of those shadowy connections with pro-Putin forces.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Governor Pence made the odd claim, he said inarguably Vladimir Putin is a better leader than President Obama.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: Don't put words in my mouth.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: Well, he never said that, Senator.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: He knew that.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Hillary Clinton has gone toe-to-toe with Russia to work out a deal on New START.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: She got them engaged on a meaningful way to cap Iran's nuclear weapons program.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And yet she stood up to them on issues such as Syria and their invasion of Georgia.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Well, this is one where we can just kind of go to the tape on it.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: But Governor Pence said, inarguably, Vladimir Putin is a better leader than President Obama.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: That is absolutely inaccurate.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And -- and -- and I just think a guy who praises...

Speaker: PENCE
Text: He said he's stronger -- he's been stronger on the world stage.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: No, he said leader.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: But the Clintons figured out a way to create a foundation where foreign governments and foreign donors could donate millions of dollars.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: And then we found, thanks to the good work of the Associated Press, that more than half her private meetings when she was secretary of state were given to major donors of the Clinton Foundation.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: The foundation was just fined for illegally contributing foundation dollars to a political campaign of a Florida attorney general.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: They made an illegal contribution, and then they tried to hide it by disguising it to somebody else.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And the person they donated to was somebody whose office was charged with investigating Trump University.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: The Trump Foundation is a private family foundation.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: They give virtually every cent in the Trump Foundation to charitable causes.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Political

Speaker: PENCE
Text: Less than ten cents on the dollar in the Clinton Foundation has gone to charitable causes.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Often China will use their veto in the Security Council to veto a package like that.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: They're starting to get worried about North Korea, too.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: So they actually supported the sanctions package, even though many of the sanctions are against Chinese firms, Chinese financial institutions.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: She went once famously to China and stood up at a human rights meeting and looked them in the eye and said, "Women's rights are human rights."

Speaker: KAINE
Text: They didn't want her to say that, but she did.

Speaker: KAINE
Text: And that is the fundamental difference between a Clinton-Kaine ticket and a Trump- Pence ticket that wants to punish women who make that choice.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: No, it's really not.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: Donald Trump and I would never support legislation that punished women who made the heartbreaking choice to end a pregnancy.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: He also said and many of them are good people.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: You keep leaving that out of your quote.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: And if you want me to go there, I'll go there.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: But here's -- there is a choice, and it is a choice on life.

Speaker: PENCE
Text: I couldn't be more proud to be standing with Donald Trump, who's standing for the right to life.

Speaker: Speaker
Text: Text

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Something happened recently where Justice Ginsburg made some very, very inappropriate statements toward me and toward a tremendous number of people, many, many millions of people that I represent.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And she was forced to apologize.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And apologize she did.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But these were statements that should never, ever have been made.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And it was a well-crafted decision.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But Hillary was extremely upset, extremely angry.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: In Chicago, which has the toughest gun laws in the United States, probably you could say by far, they have more gun violence than any other city.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: So we have the toughest laws, and you have tremendous gun violence.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Well, if we put another two or perhaps three justice on, that's really what's going to be -- that will happen.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And that'll happen automatically, in my opinion, because I am putting pro-life justices on the court.

Speaker: WALLACE
Text: And, indeed, he said women should be punished, that there should be some form of punishment for women who obtain abortions.

Speaker: WALLACE
Text: And I could just not be more opposed to that kind of thinking.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Hillary wants to give amnesty.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: She wants to have open borders.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: The border -- as you know, the Border Patrol agents, 16,500-plus ICE last week, endorsed me.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: First time they've ever endorsed a candidate.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: All of the problems -- the single biggest problem is heroin that pours across our southern border.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It's just pouring and destroying their youth.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We need the wall.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And the Border Patrol, ICE, they all want the wall.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: It means you would have to have a massive law enforcement presence, where law enforcement officers would be going school to school, home to home, business to business, rounding up people who are undocumented.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And we would then have to put them on trains, on buses to get them out of our country.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: When it comes to the wall that Donald talks about building, he went to Mexico, he had a meeting with the Mexican president.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Didn't even raise it.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He choked and then got into a Twitter war because the Mexican president said we're not paying for that wall.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: The NAFTA deal signed by her husband is one of the worst deals ever made of any kind, signed by anybody.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It's a disaster.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Hillary Clinton wanted the wall.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Hillary Clinton fought for the wall in 2006 or thereabouts.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Now, she never gets anything done, so naturally the wall wasn't built.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But Hillary Clinton wanted the wall.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: There are some limited places where that was appropriate.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: There also is necessarily going to be new technology and how best to deploy that.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Now, what I am also arguing is that bringing undocumented immigrants out from the shadows, putting them into the formal economy will be good, because then employers can't exploit them and undercut Americans' wages.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And Donald knows a lot about this.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He used undocumented labor to build the Trump Tower.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He underpaid undocumented workers, and when they complained, he basically said what a lot of employers do: "You complain, I'll get you deported."

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: I want to get everybody out of the shadows, get the economy working, and not let employers like Donald exploit undocumented workers, which hurts them, but also hurts American workers.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: President Obama has moved millions of people out.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Nobody knows about it, nobody talks about it.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But under Obama, millions of people have been moved out of this country.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They've been deported.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: People are going to come in from Syria.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: She wants 550 percent more people than Barack Obama, and he has thousands and thousands of people.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They have no idea where they come from.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I don't know Putin.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: He said nice things about me.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: He has no respect for our president.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And I'll tell you what: We're in very serious trouble, because we have a country with tremendous numbers of nuclear warheads -- 1,800, by the way -- where they expanded and we didn't, 1,800 nuclear warheads.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: The Russians have said, according to many, many reports, I can't believe they allowed us to do this.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They create warheads, and we can't.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: I -- I find it ironic that he's raising nuclear weapons.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: This is a person who has been very cavalier, even casual about the use of nuclear weapons.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He's...

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Wrong.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: ... advocated more countries getting them, Japan, Korea, even Saudi Arabia.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He said, well, if we have them, why don't we use them, which I think is terrifying.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: There's no quote.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You're not going to find a quote from me.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: ... about a potential nuclear -- nuclear competition in Asia, you said, you know, go ahead, enjoy yourselves, folks.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And defend yourselves.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I didn't say nuclear.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And defend yourself.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: That is a plan that has been analyzed by independent experts which said that it could produce 10 million new jobs.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: By contrast, Donald's plan has been analyzed to conclude it might lose 3.5 million jobs.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We will have a massive, massive tax increase under Hillary Clinton's plan.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But I'd like to start off where we left, because when I said Japan and Germany, and I'm -- not to single them out, but South Korea, these are very rich, powerful countries.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Saudi Arabia, nothing but money.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We protect Saudi Arabia.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Since I did this -- this was a year ago -- all of a sudden, they're paying.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And I've been given a lot -- a lot of credit for it.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: All of a sudden, they're starting to pay up.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They have to pay up.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We have to tell Japan in a very nice way, we have to tell Germany, all of these countries, South Korea, we have to say, you have to help us out.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We have, during his regime, during President Obama's regime, we've doubled our national debt.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Our jobs are being sucked out of our economy.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You look at all of the places that I just left, you go to Pennsylvania, you go to Ohio, you go to Florida, you go to any of them.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You go upstate New York.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Our jobs have fled to Mexico and other places.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: I also will not add a penny to the debt.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: I have costed out what I'm going to do.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He will, through his massive tax cuts, add $20 trillion to the debt.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: When my husband was president, we went from a $300 billion deficit to a $200 billion surplus and we were actually on the path to eliminating the national debt.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: When President Obama came into office, he inherited the worst economic disaster since the Great Depression.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He has cut the deficit by two-thirds.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: That's why what I have put forward doesn't add a penny to the debt, but it is the kind of approach that will enable more people to take those new jobs, higher-paying jobs.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: We're beginning to see some increase in incomes, and we certainly have had a long string of increasing jobs.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They're growing at 8 percent.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: China is growing at 7 percent.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We are growing -- our last report came out -- and it's right around the 1 percent level.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And I think it's going down.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Last week, as you know, the end of last week, they came out with an anemic jobs report.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: A terrible jobs report.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Look, our country is stagnant.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We've lost our jobs.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We've lost our businesses.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We're not making things anymore, relatively speaking.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Well, first, let me say, number one, when I saw the final agreement for TPP, I said I was against it.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: It didn't meet my test.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Donald has bought Chinese steel and aluminum.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: In fact, the Trump Hotel right here in Las Vegas was made with Chinese steel.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Just like when you ran the State Department, $6 billion was missing.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: How do you miss $6 billion?

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You ran the State Department, $6 billion was either stolen.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They don't know.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It's gone, $6 billion.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I built a massive company, a great company, some of the greatest assets anywhere in the world, worth many, many billions of dollars.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I started with a $1 million loan.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Well, first of all, those stories have been largely debunked.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Those people -- I don't know those people.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Just like if you look at what came out today on the clips where I was wondering what happened with my rally in Chicago and other rallies where we had such violence?

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: She's the one and Obama that caused the violence.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They hired people -- they paid them $1,500, and they're on tape saying be violent, cause fights, do bad things.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Because what I saw what they did, which is a criminal act, by the way, where they're telling people to go out and start fist-fights and start violence.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And I'll tell you what, in particular in Chicago, people were hurt and people could have been killed in that riot.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And that was now all on tape, started by her.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Well, he held a number of big rallies where he said that he could not possibly have done those things to those women because they were not attractive enough for them to be assaulted.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I did not say that.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I did not say that.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We have a great general, four-star general, today you read it in all of the papers, going to potentially serve five years in jail for lying to the FBI.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: One lie.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: She's lied hundreds of times to the people, to Congress, and to the FBI.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: But he also went after a disabled reporter, mocked and mimicked him on national television.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Wrong.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He went after Mr. and Mrs. Khan, the parents of a young man who died serving our country, a Gold Star family, because of their religion.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He went after John McCain, a prisoner of war, said he prefers "people who aren't captured."

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He went after a federal judge, born in Indiana, but who Donald said couldn't be trusted to try the fraud and racketeering case against Trump University because his parents were Mexican.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: So these are people that push gays off business -- off buildings.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: These are people that kill women and treat women horribly.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And yet you take their money.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: People contribute, I contribute.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: The money goes 100 percent -- 100 percent goes to different charities, including a lot of military.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I don't buy boats.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I don't buy planes.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They put up the American flag.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We fought for the right in Palm Beach to put up the American flag.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: You know, half of all immigrants -- undocumented immigrants in our country -- actually pay federal income tax.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: So we have undocumented immigrants in America who are paying more federal income tax than a billionaire.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: So let me just tell you very quickly, we're entitled because of the laws that people like her passed to take massive amounts of depreciation on other charges, and we do it.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And all of her donors -- just about all of them -- I know Buffett took hundreds of millions of dollars, Soros, George Soros, took hundreds of millions of dollars...

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I have been reading about going after Mosul now for about -- how long is it, Hillary, three months?

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: These people have all left.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Iran is taking over Iraq.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We don't gain anything.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: ... in many cases, ISIS-aligned, and we now have them in our country, and wait until you see -- this is going to be the great Trojan horse.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And wait until you see what happens in the coming years.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And during the cease-fire, Russia took over vast swatches of land, and then they said we don't want the cease-fire anymore.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We are so outplayed on missiles, on cease-fires.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: But if you look at the debt, which is the issue you asked about, Chris, I pay for everything I'm proposing.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: I do not add a penny to the national debt.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And one thing we have to do: Repeal and replace the disaster known as Obamacare.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It's destroying our country.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It's destroying our businesses, our small business and our big businesses.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It's -- the premiums are going up 60 percent, 70 percent, 80 percent.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Next year they're going to go up over 100 percent.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Our inner cities are a disaster.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You get shot walking to the store.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They have no education.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They have no jobs.

Speaker: Speaker
Text: Text

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Our jobs are fleeing the country.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They're going to Mexico.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They're going to many other countries.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You look at what China is doing to our country in terms of making our product.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They're devaluing their currency, and there's nobody in our government to fight them.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: So Ford is leaving.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You see that, their small car division leaving.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Thousands of jobs leaving Michigan, leaving Ohio.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Under my plan, I'll be reducing taxes tremendously, from 35 percent to 15 percent for companies, small and big businesses.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: That's going to be a job creator like we haven't seen since Ronald Reagan.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: You know, Donald was very fortunate in his life, and that's all to his benefit.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He started his business with $14 million, borrowed from his father, and he really believes that the more you help wealthy people, the better off we'll be and that everything will work out from there.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: When we sell into Mexico, there's a tax.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: When they sell in -- automatic, 16 percent, approximately.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: When they sell into us, there's no tax.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It's a defective agreement.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Well, let's stop for a second and remember where we were eight years ago.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: We had the worst financial crisis, the Great Recession, the worst since the 1930s.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: In fact, Donald was one of the people who rooted for the housing crisis.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He said, back in 2006, "Gee, I hope it does collapse, because then I can go in and buy some and make some money."

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Independent experts have looked at what I've proposed and looked at what Donald's proposed, and basically they've said this, that if his tax plan, which would blow up the debt by over $5 trillion and would in some instances disadvantage middle-class families compared to the wealthy, were to go into effect, we would lose 3.5 million jobs and maybe have another recession.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: They've looked at my plans and they've said, OK, if we can do this, and I intend to get it done, we will have 10 million more new jobs, because we will be making investments where we can grow the economy.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I did not.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I did not.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I do not say that.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Our energy policies are a disaster.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Our country is losing so much in terms of energy, in terms of paying off our debt.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Incomes went up for everybody.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Manufacturing jobs went up also in the 1990s, if we're actually going to look at the facts.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: When I was in the Senate, I had a number of trade deals that came before me, and I held them all to the same test.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Will they create jobs in America?

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Will they raise incomes in America?

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And are they good for our national security?

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Some of them I voted for.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: The biggest one, a multinational one known as CAFTA, I voted against.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And because I hold the same standards as I look at all of these trade deals.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You go to New England, you go to Ohio, Pennsylvania, you go anywhere you want, Secretary Clinton, and you will see devastation where manufacture is down 30, 40, sometimes 50 percent.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: NAFTA is the worst trade deal maybe ever signed anywhere, but certainly ever signed in this country.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And now you want to approve Trans-Pacific Partnership.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You were totally in favor of it.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Then you heard what I was saying, how bad it is, and you said, I can't win that debate.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Well, that is just not accurate.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: I was against it once it was finally negotiated and the terms were laid out.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And people have looked at both of our plans, have concluded that mine would create 10 million jobs and yours would lose us 3.5 million jobs, and explode the debt which would have a recession.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You are going to approve one of the biggest tax cuts in history.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You are going to approve one of the biggest tax increases in history.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You are going to drive business out.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: So we have taken the home page of my website, HillaryClinton.com, and we've turned it into a fact-checker.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: So if you want to see in real-time what the facts are, please go and take a look.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Republicans and Democrats agree that this should be done, $2.5 trillion.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I happen to think it's double that.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It's probably $5 trillion that we can't bring into our country, Lester.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: I think building the middle class, investing in the middle class, making college debt-free so more young people can get their education, helping people refinance their -- their debt from college at a lower rate.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Those are the kinds of things that will really boost the economy.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I don't mind releasing -- I'm under a routine audit.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And it'll be released.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And -- as soon as the audit's finished, it will be released.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But you will learn more about Donald Trump by going down to the federal elections, where I filed a 104-page essentially financial statement of sorts, the forms that they have.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Or maybe he doesn't want the American people, all of you watching tonight, to know that he's paid nothing in federal taxes, because the only years that anybody's ever seen were a couple of years when he had to turn them over to state authorities when he was trying to get a casino license, and they showed he didn't pay any federal income tax.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: That makes me smart.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And we've spent $6 trillion in the Middle East, according to a report that I just saw.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Whether it's 6 or 5, but it looks like it's 6, $6 trillion in the Middle East, we could have rebuilt our country twice.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: You even at one time suggested that you would try to negotiate down the national debt of the United States.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Wrong.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We have a situation where we have our inner cities, African- Americans, Hispanics are living in he'll because it's so dangerous.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You walk down the street, you get shot.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: In Chicago, they've had thousands of shootings, thousands since January 1st.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Thousands of shootings.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And I'm saying, where is this?

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Is this a war-torn country?

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: What are we doing?

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And we have to stop the violence.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We have to bring back law and order.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: In a place like Chicago, where thousands of people have been killed, thousands over the last number of years, in fact, almost 4,000 have been killed since Barack Obama became president, over -- almost 4,000 people in Chicago have been killed.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Now, whether or not in a place like Chicago you do stop and frisk, which worked very well, Mayor Giuliani is here, worked very well in New York.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It brought the crime rate way down.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: No, you're wrong.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It went before a judge, who was a very against-police judge.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It was taken away from her.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And our mayor, our new mayor, refused to go forward with the case.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They would have won an appeal.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: If you look at it, throughout the country, there are many places where it's allowed.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: No, the argument is that we have to take the guns away from these people that have them and they are bad people that shouldn't have them.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: These are felons.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And, in fact, violent crime is one-half of what it was in 1991.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Property crime is down 40 percent.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And it was terminated by current mayor.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But stop-and- frisk had a tremendous impact on the safety of New York City.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Tremendous beyond belief.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: So when you say it has no impact, it really did.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It had a very, very big impact.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Well, it's also fair to say, if we're going to talk about mayors, that under the current mayor, crime has continued to drop, including murders.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Sidney Blumenthal works for the campaign and close -- very close friend of Secretary Clinton.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And her campaign manager, Patti Doyle, went to -- during the campaign, her campaign against President Obama, fought very hard.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And you can go look it up, and you can check it out.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And if you look at CNN this past week, Patti Solis Doyle was on Wolf Blitzer saying that this happened.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Blumenthal sent McClatchy, highly respected reporter at McClatchy, to Kenya to find out about it.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They were pressing it very hard.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Now, as far as the lawsuit, yes, when I was very young, I went into my father's company, had a real estate company in Brooklyn and Queens, and we, along with many, many other companies throughout the country -- it was a federal lawsuit -- were sued.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We settled the suit with zero -- with no admission of guilt.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: In Palm Beach, Florida, tough community, a brilliant community, a wealthy community, probably the wealthiest community there is in the world, I opened a club, and really got great credit for it.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: No discrimination against African- Americans, against Muslims, against anybody.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: ... tough, long game here.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And one of the things he's done is to let loose cyber attackers to hack into government files, to hack into personal files, hack into the Democratic National Committee.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And we recently have learned that, you know, that this is one of their preferred methods of trying to wreak havoc and collect information.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I was just endorsed by ICE.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I was just recently endorsed -- 16,500 Border Patrol agents.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Well, President Obama and Secretary Clinton created a vacuum the way they got out of Iraq, because they got out -- what, they shouldn't have been in, but once they got in, the way they got out was a disaster.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And ISIS was formed.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Or, as I've been saying for a long time, and I think you'll agree, because I said it to you once, had we taken the oil -- and we should have taken the oil -- ISIS would not have been able to form either, because the oil was their primary source of income.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And now they have the oil all over the place, including the oil -- a lot of the oil in Libya, which was another one of her disasters.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Donald supported the invasion of Iraq.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Wrong.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He actually advocated for the actions we took in Libya and urged that Gadhafi be taken out, after actually doing some business with him one time.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: But the larger point -- and he says this constantly -- is George W. Bush made the agreement about when American troops would leave Iraq, not Barack Obama.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And the only way that American troops could have stayed in Iraq is to get an agreement from the then-Iraqi government that would have protected our troops, and the Iraqi government would not give that.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I haven't given lots of thought to NATO.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But two things.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Number one, the 28 countries of NATO, many of them aren't paying their fair share.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Number two -- and that bothers me, because we should be asking -- we're defending them, and they should at least be paying us what they're supposed to be paying by treaty and contract.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And about four months ago, I read on the front page of the Wall Street Journal that NATO is opening up a major terror division.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And I think that's great.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And I think we should get -- because we pay approximately 73 percent of the cost of NATO.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And that was -- believe me -- I'm sure I'm not going to get credit for it -- but that was largely because of what I was saying and my criticism of NATO.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I think we have to get NATO to go into the Middle East with us, in addition to surrounding nations, and we have to knock the hell out of ISIS, and we have to do it fast, when ISIS formed in this vacuum created by Barack Obama and Secretary Clinton.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: The record shows that I'm right.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: When I did an interview with Howard Stern, very lightly, first time anyone's asked me that, I said, very lightly, I don't know, maybe, who knows?

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I have a much better -- she spent -- let me tell you -- she spent hundreds of millions of dollars on an advertising -- you know, they get Madison Avenue into a room, they put names -- oh, temperament, let's go after -- I think my strongest asset, maybe by far, is my temperament.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I have a winning temperament.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He even said, well, you know, if there were nuclear war in East Asia, well, you know, that's fine...

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Wrong.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Just to go down the list, we defend Japan, we defend Germany, we defend South Korea, we defend Saudi Arabia, we defend countries.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: They do not pay us.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But they should be paying us, because we are providing tremendous service and we're losing a fortune.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But Russia has been expanding their -- they have a much newer capability than we do.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We have not been updating from the new standpoint.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: China should solve that problem for us.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: China should go into North Korea.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: China is totally powerful as it relates to North Korea.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I mean, can you imagine, we're defending Saudi Arabia

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And with all of the money they have, we're defending them, and they're not paying?

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: All you have to do is speak to them.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: But this is a man who has called women pigs, slobs and dogs, and someone who has said pregnancy is an inconvenience to employers, who has said...

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I never said that.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And he called this woman "Miss Piggy."

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Then he called her "Miss Housekeeping," because she was Latina.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We are a nation that is seriously troubled.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We're losing our jobs.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: People are pouring into our country.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: The other day, we were deporting 800 people.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And perhaps they passed the wrong button, they pressed the wrong button, or perhaps worse than that, it was corruption, but these people that we were going to deport for good reason ended up becoming citizens.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Ended up becoming citizens.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And it was 800.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And now it turns out it might be 1,800, and they don't even know.

Speaker: Speaker
Text: Text

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: When I watch the deals being made, when I watch what's happening with some horrible things like Obamacare, where your health insurance and health care is going up by numbers that are astronomical, 68 percent, 59 percent, 71 percent, when I look at the Iran deal and how bad a deal it is for us, it's a one-sided transaction where we're giving back $150 billion to a terrorist state, really, the number one terror state, we've made them a strong country from really a very weak country just three years ago.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: When I look at all of the things that I see and all of the potential that our country has, we have such tremendous potential, whether it's in business and trade, where we're doing so badly.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Last year, we had almost $800 billion trade deficit.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Just today, policemen was shot, two killed.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And this is happening on a weekly basis.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I have great respect for women.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Nobody has more respect for women than I do.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: We've seen him rate women on their appearance, ranking them from one to ten.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: We've seen him embarrass women on TV and on Twitter.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: We saw him after the first debate spend nearly a week denigrating a former Miss Universe in the harshest, most personal terms.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I heard them when they were running for the Senate in New York, where Hillary was going to bring back jobs to upstate New York and she failed.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I've heard them where Hillary is constantly talking about the inner cities of our country, which are a disaster education-wise, jobwise, safety-wise, in every way possible.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: If you look at Bill Clinton, far worse.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Mine are words, and his was action.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: His was what he's done to women.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: There's never been anybody in the history politics in this nation that's been so abusive to women.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: So you can say any way you want to say it, but Bill Clinton was abusive to women.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Hillary Clinton attacked those same women and attacked them viciously.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: One of the women, who is a wonderful woman, at 12 years old, was raped at 12.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Her client she represented got him off, and she's seen laughing on two separate occasions, laughing at the girl who was raped.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But what President Clinton did, he was impeached, he lost his license to practice law.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: He had to pay an $850,000 fine to one of the women.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: But he never apologizes for anything to anyone.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He never apologized to Mr. and Mrs. Khan, the Gold Star family whose son, Captain Khan, died in the line of duty in Iraq.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And Donald insulted and attacked them for weeks over their religion.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He never apologized to the distinguished federal judge who was born in Indiana, but Donald said he couldn't be trusted to be a judge because his parents were, quote, "Mexican."

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He never apologized to the reporter that he mimicked and mocked on national television and our children were watching.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And he never apologized for the racist lie that President Obama was not born in the United States of America.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: He owes the president an apology, he owes our country an apology, and he needs to take responsibility for his actions and his words.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Well, you owe the president an apology, because as you know very well, your campaign, Sidney Blumenthal -- he's another real winner that you have -- and he's the one that got this started, along with your campaign manager, and they were on television just two weeks ago, she was, saying exactly that.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I've gotten to see the commercials that they did on you.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And I've gotten to see some of the most vicious commercials I've ever seen of Michelle Obama talking about you, Hillary.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Right now, we are at 90 percent health insurance coverage.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: That's the highest we've ever been in our country.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And not only expensive for the person that has it, unbelievably expensive for our country.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It's going to be one of the biggest line items very shortly.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: She wants to go to a single-payer plan, which would be a disaster, somewhat similar to Canada.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And if you haven't noticed the Canadians, when they need a big operation, when something happens, they come into the United States in many cases because their system is so slow.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: You know that, because Jonathan Gruber, the architect of Obamacare, was said -- he said it was a great lie, it was a big lie.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: President Obama said you keep your doctor, you keep your plan.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: The whole thing was a fraud, and it doesn't work.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But when we get rid of those lines, you will have competition, and we will be able to keep pre-existing, we'll also be able to help people that can't get -- don't have money because we are going to have people protected.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Look at that horrible -- these are radical Islamic terrorists.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And she won't even mention the word and nor will President Obama.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: He won't use the term "radical Islamic terrorism."

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And Hillary Clinton wants to allow a 550 percent increase over Obama.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: People are coming into our country like we have no idea who they are, where they are from, what their feelings about our country is, and she wants 550 percent more.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But I don't want to have, with all the problems this country has and all of the problems that you see going on, hundreds of thousands of people coming in from Syria when we know nothing about them.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We know nothing about their values and we know nothing about their love for our country.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And indeed, you can look at the propaganda on a lot of the terrorists sites, and what Donald Trump says about Muslims is used to recruit fighters, because they want to create a war between us.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And the final thing I would say, this is the 10th or 12th time that he's denied being for the war in Iraq.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: We have it on tape.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: The entire press corps has looked at it.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I was against -- I was against the war in Iraq.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Has not been debunked.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And they don't want them.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And Hillary Clinton, when she was secretary of state, said that's OK, we can't force it into their country.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We're also letting drugs pour through our southern border at a record clip.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: At a record clip.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: As I recall, that was something I said about Abraham Lincoln after having seen the wonderful Steven Spielberg movie called "Lincoln."

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: It was a master class watching President Lincoln get the Congress to approve the 13th Amendment.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And she lied.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Now she's blaming the lie on the late, great Abraham Lincoln.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But I don't know Putin.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But I notice, anytime anything wrong happens, they like to say the Russians are -- she doesn't know if it's the Russians doing the hacking.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Maybe there is no hacking.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I have no businesses there.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I have no loans from Russia.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Soros, who's a friend of hers, took a massive deduction.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Many of the people that are giving her all this money that she can do many more commercials than me gave her -- took massive deductions.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I pay hundreds of millions of dollars in taxes.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But we're bringing the tax rate down from 35 percent to 15 percent.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We're cutting taxes for the middle class.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And I will tell you, we are cutting them big league for the middle class.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And I will tell you, Hillary Clinton is raising your taxes, folks.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We have no growth in this country.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: There's no growth.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: See, I understand the tax code better than anybody that's ever run for president.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Hillary Clinton -- and it's extremely complex -- Hillary Clinton has friends that want all of these provisions, including they want the carried interest provision, which is very important to Wall Street people.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: But they really want the carried interest provision, which I believe Hillary's leaving.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: She's made bad judgments on Libya, on Syria, on Iraq.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I mean, her and Obama, whether you like it or not, the way they got out of Iraq, the vacuum they've left, that's why ISIS formed in the first place.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: First of all, she was there as secretary of state with the so-called line in the sand, which...

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: No, I wasn't.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: I was gone.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I don't like Assad at all, but Assad is killing ISIS.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Russia is killing ISIS.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And Iran is killing ISIS.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And those three have now lined up because of our weak foreign policy.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: It stripped us of manufacturing jobs.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We lost our jobs.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We lost our money.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: We lost our plants.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: She called it the gold standard.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: And by the way, at the last debate, she lied, because it turned out that she did say the gold standard and she said she didn't say it.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: And there's a lot of fear -- in fact, teachers and parents are calling it the Trump effect.

Speaker: CLINTON
Text: Bullying is up.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: She said who is going to answer the call at 3 o'clock in the morning?

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Guess what?

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: She didn't answer it, because when Ambassador Stevens...

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: I ask Hillary, why doesn't -- she made $250 million by being in office.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: She used the power of her office to make a lot of money.

Speaker: TRUMP
Text: Why isn't she funding, not for $100 million, but why don't you put $10 million or $20 million or $25 million or $30 million into your own campaign?
